Технологии Деньги Достижения
Пройти квиз
Разработка: студия ЯР
1922
- undefined

December 26, 1922, RSFSR Council of People's Commissars established savings offices the main objective of which was enabling the population 
to keep spare cash in a safe manner. Population savings started to be used as a main source 
for financing of country's industrialization.

1923
- undefined

In 1923, Minsk saw opened Central Savings Office No. 16 to manage the development of saving banking in Belarus.

1924
- undefined

By the end of 1924, within the Belarusian boundaries of that time, 219 savings offices were opened among which 192 were located in rural area – and this despite the fact that highly experienced staff was in increasingly short supply, the facilities and resources also left much 
to be desired. However, people's need 
in depositing cash kept growing, for that reason savings offices continued to open all across 
the country.

1925
- undefined

By the end of 1925, savings offices employees attracted more than 15 thousand of depositors. All indications are, that public servants had the most money at that time, they consisted a major part of depositors. Workers were in second place and peasants came only after them.

1931
- undefined

In 1931, the market saw a new product – purpose-oriented deposits. They entitled working people to save money with savings offices for bicycle, camera or sewing machine. When the amount 
on deposit reached the price for a product, 
the depositor was given a special document allowing to buy the desired product in a shop.

1941
- undefined

In 1941, organizational construction of savings offices system was completed: 1354 savings offices in all regions of the republic were 
servicing 423 thousand depositors.

1941
- 1945

During the Great Patriotic war, savings offices employees were helping to finance the military defense. During evacuation, they were removing valuables from savings offices. There were times, when there were neither packing materials, 
no transports, therefore employees were bringing tablecloths, bedsheets, mattresses 
and sometimes, under bombardment, 
they were carrying valuables on their shoulders.

- 1945
1941
- 1945

Savings offices continued to work. Evacuated 
to Kazan, the Republican Department of State Treasury and State Credit was engaged in searching for valuables and documents taken 
to the rear from the occupied territory of Belarus. The branches of savings offices were establishing in rear hospitals. A network of field savings institutions was arranged in the active army, which were receiving and issuing deposits at the front lines. There were subscriptions to military loans, the sale of cash and prize lotteries, fund-raising for the Defense Fund and the Red Army Fund. 
At the height of the war, the award 
"For excellence in finance business" was initiated and developed to celebrate people who were actively participating in the process. Award pin "For excellent work for Belarusbank" is given to the best employees of the bank even nowadays.

- 1945
1947
- undefined

In 1947, Money Reform was held. Its purpose was to remove from circulation money surpluses appeared during the war years and replace the old banknotes for the new ones. The Reform heighten the population interest to savings offices – depositors were better off. Money being in the hands of population, were exchanged in the ratio of 1:10, and deposits held with savings offices up to 3 thousand rubles – in the ratio of 1:1, 
up to 10 thousand rubles – 3:2 
and above 10 thousand rubles – 2:1.

1958
- undefined

In 1958, savings offices restarted selling lottery tickets, which, by the way, can be bought at Belarusbank branch offices even nowadays. 
Over 10 years, the lottery tickets were sold 
for 45 thousand rubles, winners were paid 
out 21 thousand.

1963
- undefined

In 1963, all employees of savings offices implemented in their work a new business process to accept payments for utility services. The scope of work tripled. The most popular payments at that time were payments for apartment, utility services and day care centers.

1984
- undefined

Belarusian savings offices worked out 
a new deposit – bonus-bearing deposit for young-adults 
in the age of 18-30 years old. The initial contribution was 10, 20, 30, 40 or 50 rubles, 
to be deposited at once, once done, during 
3 years, every month an employer or an education institution were transferring to this deposit account 
the amount of the initial contribution.

1987
- undefined

In 1987, savings offices were turned into 
the Savings Bank. At the same time, 
the Bank launched consumer loans.

1991
- undefined

The world map saw a new State – 
Republic of Belarus, around that time, 
new Articles of Association of Savings Bank 
were approved. Since then, the Bank acquired 
its independence in defining its own policy.

1994
- undefined

In 1994, Savings Bank's branches started 
to provide integrated services for entities 
of different forms of ownership, firstly, 
for small and medium enterprises.

1994
- undefined

Upon receiving independence, Belarus saw appeared 25 banks one of which was very successful – Joint-Stock Commercial Bank Belarusbank. Republic of Belarus President Decree No. 340 dd 30.08.95 by way of merger 
of the Savings Bank of the Republic of Belarus 
and Joint-Stock Commercial Bank Belarusbank established Open Joint-Stock Company 
"Savings Bank Belarusbank". The modern period 
in the bank's development has begun.

1996
- undefined

In 1996, Belarusbank started to issue plastic cards and became a member of EUROPAY International Payment System.

1997
- undefined

In 1997, Belarusbank established its representative offices in Moscow and Warsaw.

1998
- undefined

In 1998, Belarusbank issued the first plastic card of Mastercard payment system.

2000
- undefined

In 2000, the Bank became a member 
of VISA International.

2001
- undefined

Since 2001, Fitch Ratings started assigning 
ratings to Belarusbank.

2002
- undefined

In 2002, the building of Belarusbank Head Office saw the opening of a museum. It became the first museum of that kind in our country.

2003
- undefined

In 2003, Belarusbank launched a new service 
to the market – Strizh fast transfer 
of Belarusian money.

2003
- undefined

In 2003, Belarusbank established a representative office in Germany (Frankfurt am Main).

2004
- undefined

In 2004, Belarusbank issued its one millionth card.

2004
- undefined

In 2004, Belarusbank was assigned ownership 
of two farm enterprises in Uzdensk region – Stalbovschina and Pervaya Vesna.

2004
- undefined

In 2004, Belarusbank was the first among Belarusian commercial banks to start offering bonds for individuals.

2005
- undefined

In 2005, Belarusbank received license 
for performing operations with precious 
metals and precious gems.

2006
- undefined

Since 2006, the Bank's customers – holders 
of VISA Electron and Maestro could withdraw 
from ATM not only Belarusian rubles 
but also US dollars.

2006
- undefined

Fitch Ratings upgraded all Belarusbank's ratings. Outlook on these ratings was Stable.

2006
- undefined

In 2006, Belarusbank was the first among 
the country's banks to overcome two million milestone for issue of plastic cards.

2006
- undefined

In 2006, Belarusbank was admitted as a member of the International Forfaiting Association 
and became the first representative among financial and banking institutions 
of the Republic of Belarus.

2006
- undefined

In 2006, ASB Health and Recreation center Sputnik, built by Belarusbank, started its work. 
At that time, 150 persons could have rest 
there at once.

2007
- undefined

Belarusbank established its representative office in Beijing – the forth one in succession. Prior to that, representative offices were established 
in Moscow, Warsaw and Frankfurt am Main.

2008
- undefined

2008 is the birth year of Belarusbank 
Internet-Banking. Since that moment, the Bank's customers received a remote access to their accounts and started to make their payments through the Internet. That year also M-Banking appeared.

2008
- undefined

Belarusbank introduced foreign exchange transactions in the currency of the People's Bank of China. Afterwards, it started accepting money for Multifunctional term deposit in foreign currency (RNB).

2008
- undefined

In October, Memorundum of Understanding with Deutsche Börse Group was signed – operator 
of the largest Security Exchange 
in Germany – Frankfurt Stock Exchange.

2009
- undefined

In 2009, Western Union agents’ conference 
was held in Capetown. There, Belarusbank 
was awarded as the best bank in the world 
for the quality of customer services under 
the Western Union system.

2009
- undefined

Belarusbank began to sell certified diamonds through its branch chain.

2009
- undefined

Global Finance awarded Belarusbank 
as the best bank in the country. 58 largest banks from around the world participated in the Awards Ceremony.

2009
- undefined

Belarusbank and Warsaw Stock Exchange signed Partnership Agreement. It enabled Belarusian companies to entry into 
the international capital market.

2009
- undefined

As part of the State Housing Construction Program, Belarusbank issued more than 
3 trillion Belarusian rubles, putting into operation more than 30,000 apartments with a total area 
of 2.3 million square meters.

2009
- undefined

Over the year, balance of loans issued to Belarus citizens increased up to 
10.7 trillion rubles (which is 835 thousands valid agreements).

2010
- undefined

Belarusbank issued its four millionth plastic card. Let us recall, that the Bank's 
one millionth card was issued in 2004.

2010
- undefined

Belarusbank signed the first trilateral Framework Agreement in the history of the banking system with French and Belgian banks.

2010
- undefined

Over the year, Belarusbank gained profit of more than 510 bln rubles. At that time, it was one third 
of profit of the entire banking system.

2010
- undefined

Euromoney magazine announced Belarusbank "The best bank in Belarus".

2010
- undefined

The scope of exchange transactions performed by Belarusbank customers 
and the bank itself surpassed USD 5 bln.

2010
- undefined

By the end of 2010, Belarusbank provided services for about 88,500 legal entities and individual entrepreneurs.

2010
- undefined

Trade Finance magazine named the project for financing of an agreement between Belarusian Railways and Stadler Bussnang AG (Switzerland) 
as "Project of the Year 2010 in Belarus".

2010
- undefined

The share of cashless transactions 
for plastic cards in the total scope of debit transactions within the whole network 
of Belarusbank accounted for 17.6 %.

2010
- undefined

In 2010, Belarusbank was the owner of a number of farming enterprises among which ASB Gorodets, ASB Teterino, ASB Pervaya Vesna, 
ASB Novator.

2010
- undefined

In 2010, Belarusbank saw appeared its call center. 147 phone number became popular among Belarusians.

2011
- undefined

Moody`s Investors Service Ltd confirmed international ratings of Belarusbank: Long-Term Global Foreign-Currency Deposit Rating as B2, Long-Term Global Local-Currency Deposit Rating as B1, Bank Financial Strength Rating as E+, outlook was stable.

2011
- undefined

The thousandth Belarusbank ATM appeared within the territory of our country. 
It started functioning in Loshitsa District of our capital. Besides, the two-thousandth infokiosk 
was put into operation in Vitebsk.

2011
- undefined

The balance of money raised through 
the sale of the bank's bonds to legal entities 
and individuals exceeded EUR 1 bln in 2011.

2011
- undefined

In 2011, the market share of Belarusbank came 
to 71% for loans to individuals and 45% 
for deposits of individuals.

2011
- undefined

Standard&Poors international rating agency improved its outlook for credit ratings 
of Belarusbanks from Negative to Stable.

2011
- undefined

Belarusbank which assets as at January 1, 2011 came to USD 17.6 bln, was recognized as the largest non-Russian credit institution in Top 100 CIS Banks ranking in terms of assets, which allowed it be included into the Top 10 largest 
CIS banks.

2012
- undefined

By spring 2012, Belarusbank had attracted 
more than USD 7 bln of foreign resources 
to the economy of our country.

2012
- undefined

On May 9, 2012, Belarusbank was officially admitted as a member of the World Savings Banks Institute during the 19th General Assembly. 
This organization united at that time companies from 91 countries of the world with joint assets more than EUR 9 trillion.

2012
- undefined

Belarusbank became the first in Belarus 
to receive certificate for acquiring 
of contactless cards in 2012.

2012
- undefined

On September, 17 the official ceremony 
of opening of the new Belarusbank head office building took place at 18 Dzerzhinski Avenue 
in Minsk.

2013
- undefined

In May 2013, the number of users of Belarusbank remote banking services surpassed 1,000,000 persons.

2014
- undefined

Belarusbank started granting loans on preferential terms to pay for in vitro fertilization.

2014
- undefined

Тhе Banker international edition recognized dynamic development of Belarsbank by ranking it up by 227 positions in TOP 1000 of World Banks rating. Our Bank was ranked 400th among 1000 largest banks of the world.

2015
- undefined

Belarusbank was the first in the country to provide the customers with the possibility 
to transfer money through phone number. 
New service became available for M-banking users.

2015
- undefined

In 2015, the ceremony of signing the General Facility Agreement between Belarusbank 
and China Development Bank was held for granting the loan facility to the tune 
of USD 300 mln.

2015
- undefined

In 2015, ASB Consult, the Bank's subsidiary consulting company, was founded.

2015
- undefined

Belarusbank became the General Partner 
of the Association "Hockey Federation 
of the Republic of Belarus", two years earlier 
the Bank signed a Cooperation Agreement with the Association "Belarusian Football Federation".

2016
- undefined

Belarusbank attracted the largest syndicated loan totaling USD 265 mln.

2016
- undefined

Belarusbank was the first 
in CIS countries to launch a new 
innovative product – Internet-bonds.

2016
- undefined

Global Inclusion Awards 2016 recognized Belarusbank product "Pupil Card" as a winner 
in the category for the best banking product 
for children and youth.

2017
- undefined

Belarusbank acceded to the UN Global Compact Initiative in the field of corporate social responsibility.

2017
- undefined

The Bank became an initiator and sponsor 
of the unique project – book in Belarusian language for children of primary school age "Groshyk and mysterial basket. The ABC 
of Financial Literacy from Belarusbank". 
(Groshyk is a fictional character looking like 
a golden coin but with closes put on it.)

2018
- undefined

Belarusbank and the largest international Companies Group Dana Holdings launched 
the partnership project – "Mortgage with us".

2018
- undefined

Minsk saw opened the first Mortgage office in Belarus.

2018
- undefined

Belarusbank in partnership with 
Samsung Electronics and Mastercard provided 
an opportunity to its customers to pay 
for purchases using the Samsung Pay service.

2018
- undefined

Belarusbank became the participant 
of the large-scale project – Great Stone Industrial Park. To provide comprehensive banking services to legal entities and individuals, a Bank's branch office was established in the Company's Administrative building.

2018
- undefined

Belarusbank and China UnionPay represented 
by the UnionPay International Subsidiary concluded a Partnership Agreement for maintenance of UnionPay payments cards 
at shopping malls and service enterprises 
within the territory of Belarus.

2018
- undefined

Belarusbank share in the housing lending market accounted for almost 50 % in 2018.

2018
- undefined

Belarusbank charity project 
"Belarusbank. Parental Home" became the best Corporate Social Responsibility project 
of the "Big Heart" nomination of the fifth jubilee ceremony of the HR-Brand Award Belarus 2018.

2018
- undefined

EMEA Finance International financial magazine recognized Belarusbank the best bank in Belarus in 2018. ASB Broker, the bank’s Subsidiary, 
also was awarded: it was named the best Broker 
in Belarus. EMEA has been naming Belarusbank since 2010 not only the Best Bank in Belarus 
but also the Best investment bank in Belarus.

2019
- undefined

the first stage of Belarusbank 
and Belpochta common project was completed: from now on, it is possible to issue the entire line of deposits in Belarusian rubles in post offices, open an account using a card and replenish it, issue a package of documents and conclude loan agreements.

2019
- undefined

Belarusbank and Visa presented 
Student Card.

2019
- undefined

Belarusbank charity project 
"Belarusbank. Parental Home" became one 
of the winners of the competition of social projects "Partnership for Sustainable Development 2019", organized by the local network of the UN Global Compact in Ukraine.

2020
- undefined

Belarsubank and Cashew fintech startup launched an innovative payment method using 
a QR code.

2020
- undefined

Belarusbank presented the innovative project "Look and pass". This service allows paying the trip by metro using technology of face recognition.

2020
- undefined

Belarusbank and the Swiss bank UBS Switzerland AG financed the purchase of Stadler electric trains for the Belarusian Railways at a cost of more than EUR 90 million.

2020
- undefined

The first legal cryptocurrency exchange service was launched in Belarus: since November 2020, Belarusbank has offered opportunity to Visa card holders to replenish e-wallets for further purchase and sale of cryptocurrencies.

2020
- undefined

Belarusbank became honoree and prizewinner 
in the Bank of the Year-2020 Awards: it won 
in the Deal of the Year nomination and became 
a prizewinner in the nominations Investment Bank, Best Bank among Large Banks with Domestic Capital, Leader in Lending. 
Moreover, based on the results of Internet 
voting Belarusbank took the second place. 
In addition, one of the partners of the award – Kaspersky Lab – recognized the bank among 
the laureates of the Information Security nomination.

2020
- undefined

Belarusbank became winner of the international festival contest "Choice of the Year" 
in the "Bank No. 1" nomination. 
It was the 13th medal of the bank in this contest.

2020
- undefined

Master Cooperation Agreement was made between Belarusbank, China-Belarus Industrial Park Administration and Industrial Park Development Company. Belarusbank Chairman Viktar Ananich signed the document.

2021
- undefined

Thanks to the opening by Belarusbank in 2021 
of multi-currency accounts in the Interstate Bank, Belarusians living in the EAEU countries and Moldova can receive pensions in the currency 
of their country of residence.

2021
- undefined

Global Finance, worldwide known financial edition, announced winners of "The Innovators 2021: Finance" annual award: Belarusbank became "2021 Outstanding Innovator in Payments" for its “Look and Pass” service. Belarusbank has been receiving awards from Global Finance since 2009, 7 times, including naming as the Best Bank in Belarus in 2020 within the "World's Best Banks 2020", repeatedly it was recognized the best in Belarus in such nominations as "The World’s Best Foreign Exchange Providers", "Safest Banks By Country", "World’s Best Emerging Markets Banks in Central & Eastern Europe".

2021
- undefined

Belarusbank launched the delivery 
of payment cards by post.

2022
- undefined

Belarusbank celebrates 
its 100th anniversary!
